args:
Farren is a young man who was captured by the
Syndicate and transformed into a wyrmbound
soldier. One day, the Syndicate attempts to
eliminate everyone at the facility in order to
hide their misdeeds, and Farren stands up to
protect everyone.
The Synthetic Shapeshifting Project is\nat last ready to advance to its next stage.
And with it, the prospect of mass\nproduction draws ever closer.

It was quite unexpected that unit TF-997—
thought to be a failure—would prove
useful for achieving the breakthrough
we needed.

This ＂wyrmbinding＂ magic... It was
developed by the Doctor, yes? A way
to restrain dragons and make use of
their power.

Indeed. Our attempts at permanent fusing
were far too unstable, but this new design
utilizing separate but combinable entities
appears to be the solution.
We have also succeeded in cultivating\ndragons thanks to the mana collected in\nthe Doctor's former laboratory.

All that remains is to repeat the process
and ascertain the proper balance between
the human host and the dragon shell. And
we have already secured ＂assets＂ for that...
Then let our work on the Wyrmbound\nSoldier Project commence!
...I can't believe they've made so much\nprogress. I'll have to pick up my pace\nas well.
Ow! Geez, no need for the rough stuff...
Heya, folks! I'm Farren. Nice to meetcha.
We don't care who you are. Once the\nexperiments start up, we'll all be dead\nin a few days anyway.
C'mon, that's no way to talk! Where's your\nhope?! There's always a chance if you just\nhave a little hope!
You idiot. You're only saying that because\nyou have no idea how utterly terrible\nthings are around here.
Gotcha! If there's no hope to be found in\nthis place, we'll just make our own!
Let that be a lesson to you.\nIf you don't want more o' that, then settle\ndown and be quiet.
Well, that could have gone better.\nYou okay, new guy? Here, take this—\nit'll help cool that bruise.
Name's Jake. Good to meet you, Farren.
Same! Boy, it sure is great to make a new\nfriend so quickly.
Ha ha ha! You're an odd duck, Farren.\nYou DO know where we are, right?
Kiiinda? It's a research lab for some\ngroup called the Syndicate, right?
That's right. Sadly, we're the lab rats—\nthe kinds that don't ever come back,\nif you get my drift.

Folks here don't even know if they'll see
another sunrise, so maybe that helps you
understand why all your talk of ＂hope＂ isn't
exactly filling them with confidence.
Not knowing if you'll see tomorrow is no\nreason to give up hope today!
Yep. A very odd duck. Still, I like you.\nHope you stick around for a bit.
Yep! I don't know if we can pull it off,\nbut if we don't do something, nothing\nwill ever change around here.
Guess betting our lives on a crazy escape\nplan beats sitting around waiting to end up\nsmooshed in a beaker somewhere.
So, I've been listening to the guards\nrecently and it sounds like there's a lot\nof tension brewing.
Apparently there's some guy named Aldred\nwho's fighting back against the Syndicate.
Rumor has it he's set his sights\non this facility.
If he's opposing the Syndicate,\nthat means he's on our side!

Yeaaah, not exactly. Apparently he kills
everyone in sight when he attacks a
Syndicate facility—adults, kids, prisoners,
you name it.

So with that kind of delightful news
bearing down on us, your plan is starting
to sound pretty good. What exactly did
you have in mind, anyway?
Um...nothing? I thought maybe we could\ncome up with the details together.
Quack quack, little duck. Well, seeing as\nthis is quite literally a matter of life and\ndeath, let's see what we can come up with.
Exactly. I think we can yank out some of\nthe tiles on the ground, then dig our way\nout from there.
Timing's gonna be tight as hell, though.\nI mean, we could be dragged out of here\nand killed at pretty much any moment.
And honestly, the biggest hurdle might be\nthat it requires the cooperation of the rest\nof the prisoners in this joint.
Aw, that's fine. We just have to help them\nremember what it means to hope!

And so we commenced our plan to escape from
the Syndicate. We even managed to get the folks
in the prison to cooperate, and it seemed like
things were going well. But then...
Listen up, all! One of you is about to\nreceive the honor of being the latest\nsubject of the Syndicate's great research!
Doesn't matter who, but if someone is\nwilling to volunteer, that'll make things\na lot easier on everyone.
Volunteer to be killed, you mean!
I don't want to die! Not now!
Where's Jake?! What happened to him?!
He said the rest of us need you if we're\ngoing to escape. Said you're the only one\nwho could give us all hope.
No! Why does this always happen to me?!
All I can say is that I think Jake was right,\nso I'm gonna make sure he doesn't die\nfor nothing.
...You're right...and that means I'm gonna\nget you all out of here, no matter what!
Just a little more and... Yes! I'm through!
I'm outside! We're outside the facility!\nWe did it, Jake!
Okay, this is no time to get sentimental.\nI need to let the others know so we can\nget out of here before the sun comes up.
I can't believe you actually thought\nthis would work.
Did you think we would actually be fool\nenough to miss such an obvious plot?
We're going to slit your throat and leave\nthe body where everyone can find it so\nno one ever tries this again.
Oh, but that would be a terrible waste of\none with such force of will. Instead, let us\nuse him for the shell-grafting experiment.
Take him to the operating room.
I'm sorry, Jake! I'm sorry, everyone!
...It failed? But I heard the operation\nwas a great success!
The human host is fine, and the dragon\nshell did not go berserk. By all known\nmetrics, it should have been successful.
But the wyrmbinding failed to activate.\nThe shell could not be charged.

However, I believe we have identified the
problem areas and am confident we will
have a perfected wyrmbound soldier in the
very near future.
What do we do with this one?

We have no use for failures. Throw him
in a cell somewhere. He'll be taken care
of soon, I imagine. Toss the useless shell
in with him.
This is a different jail cell than before.\nGosh, I sure hope nothing bad happened\nto all my other prisoner friends...
He's here! Aldred is here! Scramble the\ntroops! Scramble EEEVERYYYYOOOOONE!
Aldred? That's the name Jake mentioned!
He's the man who storms Syndicate\nfacilities and kills everyone inside...
Ack! I gotta think of a way to get all my\nfriends out of here!
I'll break a wall! ...No, not strong enough.\nBend the bars! ...Wait, no. Same problem.\nI'll dig a hole! ...Poop! No time!
Okay, okay. Don't give up, Farren.\nThere's hope! There's ALWAYS hope!
Yes, help me! And wait—who are you?!

Well, that's a hell of a way to treat yer
new partner. 'Course, I'm more like a
second heart than a partner, what with
how connected we are.
Eh, technically, I'm a pseudo-dragon\ncreated by the Syndicate to be the shell\ndealie for a wyrmbound.
They called me ＂Barbatos B-Unit,＂ but that\nname smells like yesterday's onions,\nso I'll pass.
But you and me got bigger fish to catch\nright now, bucko. So what's it gonna be?\nWant the power to bust outta this joint?
Make sure you're sure, 'cause I might go\naskin' for something in return later, yeah?
I'll give you anything I can if it means I'll\nbe able to help my friends!
You've either got a pound of guts or an\nounce of brains, but I ain't complainin'\neither way. Let's do this thing!
Aaah! What the heck is this thing\non my arm!?
That's wyrmbinding, bucko! The power\nthose Syndicate chumps gave us!
AAAAAAH! My right arm just TALKED!\nUm, are you Barbatos B-Unit...sir?

Told ya I don't like that name. Also, let's
focus on the important stuff—like how
you're now wielding more power than the
average mid-sized dragon.
Oh wow... That's great! Thanks, Lil' Barb!
...Lil' Barb? Are ya kiddin' me here?\nIf that name was any lazier, it'd come\nwith a pillow and a mattress!
Aw, I think it's cute. Now, c'mon!\nLet's bust outta here! Haaaah!
Whoa, this really IS a ton of power...\nI might actually be able to do this!
Quit grinnin' like an idiot and pay\nattention already! We got company!
Huh. You must be one of the wyrmbound\nGrace told me about.
Oh wow, look at your body... Do you have\nthe same thing going on as me, mister?!

Knock off the small talk, bucko! This here's
one of the earlier models, the kind what's
always fused to his dragon. Goes by the
handle Tf-997—also known as Aldred!
Sorry, kid, but I can't let your power be\nreleased into the world. Time to die.
Bucko? I highly suggest ya run before this\nguy wipes the floor with the both of us.
No! If I run, everyone here will be killed!
Stand and fight, turn and run—makes no\ndifference to me. I'll kill you either way.
I'm gonna protect my friends!\nI'll protect them AAAAAAAALL!
Nnngh! Okay, wasn't expecting that...\nTime to up the ante!
I better end things before this little runt\nrealizes how strong he actually is...
Aldred! What are you doing?!\nWe don't have time for this!
Ah, Grace. I'm dealing with this\nwyrmbound. He's just as dangerous as\nexpected. I can't let him run free!
Wyrmbound...? That can't be right.\nThe project hasn't been successful...\n...What?!
The wyrmbound shell is working...?\nBut the test supposedly ended in failure...
It didn't ＂fail.＂ I just didn't do it.\nBecause I didn't want to do what those\nSyndicate jerks wanted.
And now the Barbatos B-Unit is talking?\nThis is highly irregular indeed...
Given what you're saying, may I assume\nyou hold no loyalty to the Syndicate?
Who the hell would be loyal to the chumps\nwhat screwed with my body?!
Aldred, I don't think these two are our\nenemies after all.
Wait, so you AREN'T attacking Syndicate\nfacilities and killing all the prisoners?
*sigh* Sounds like they've painted us in\na rather unseemly light...
Anyone who willingly throws their lot in\nwith the Syndicate is fair game, but we're\ntrying to FREE the prisoners.
So we have no reason to fight?
On the contrary, having you on our side\nright now should prove quite useful.
The Syndicate has decided to abandon this\nfacility, which means they are going to\ndestroy it along with all of their prisoners.
If we do nothing, all of their test subjects\nwill die. I would very much prefer for that\nnot to happen.
Dirty rotten scum doing dirty rotten things.\nHey, you there. Kid. What's your name?
Well, Farren, if you've got folks you want\nto protect and you're willing to put your\nlife on the line to do it, then join us.
